The "Glossary S-Z" is a comprehensive reference guide that provides definitions and explanations of gambling-related terms from S to Z. This glossary is designed to assist individuals in understanding the terminology commonly used in the gambling industry.

== Glossary Terms S-Z ==

=== S ===
; Slot Machine
: A gambling machine with three or more reels that spin when a button is pushed. Slot machines are also known as "pokies" in Australia.
; Sports Betting
: The activity of predicting sports results and placing a wager on the outcome.

=== T ===
; Table Games
: Casino games played on a table, such as blackjack, roulette, and baccarat.
; Turnover
: The total amount of money wagered by a player or players during a specific period.

=== U ===
; Underlay
: A bet that has less chance of winning than implied by the odds.
; Unit
: A standard amount of money used to denote the size of a bet.

=== V ===
; Vig (Vigorish)
: The fee charged by a bookmaker for accepting a wager.
; Video Poker
: A casino game based on five-card draw poker played on a computerized console.

=== W ===
; Wager
: Another term for a bet.
; Whale
: A high-stakes gambler who wagers large amounts of money.

=== X ===
; X-factor
: An unknown or unpredictable element that can affect the outcome of a game.

=== Y ===
; Yield
: The return on investment from a bet, expressed as a percentage.

=== Z ===
; Zero Sum Game
: A situation in which one participant's gain or loss is exactly balanced by the losses or gains of other participants.
